fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28856].
  {panel}

In our environment, we have thousands of users, and our users have auto-generated usernames like "01234567" or "cc12345". For "User" custom fields such as "Tester" or "Resolution Prime" which are frequently used by our users, the "Edit Screen" and email notifications show:

Tester: cc12345
Resolution Prime: cc98765

Our users find this very problematic to use as they cannot map the username to person in their head and it is unclear which person these issues are referring to. When editing - they have to switch back to view mode to see what person the field is referring to, and for email notifications they need to click into the issue to see issue in view mode to understand what person the field is referring to, which negates the values of the user field being in the email notification in the first place.

"Reporter" and "Assignee" show the user's display name, so:

Tester: Mark Mielke
Resolution Prime: Mark Mielke

We want "user" custom fields to operate the same as "Reporter" and "Assignee" for "Edit Screen" and email notifications.

We recognize that our numeric usernames may make us somewhat unique - however, I would suggest that any company with thousands of users will eventually find that usernames conflict, and a scheme such as "first letter of first name, followed by last name" resulting in "mmielke" for myself, will eventually break down, leading to "majohnso" to represent "Mark Johnson", and the same problem as we have with numeric usernames exists with a formula based username.
fields.summary: "User" custom fields should show display name in "Edit Screen" and email notifications, just like "Reporter" and "Assignee" do
As a JIRA admin, I want all of my links to Confluence pages to update if the Confluence trusted link is changed
Add ability to change default value of 'Clone Sub Tasks' checkbox on 'Clone Issue' screen
Export issues result as HTML
Searching for attatched files

Can you please add additional information to the logs for export? I can appreciate it may look trivial initially, however if someone is upgrading their instance it exports before importing. Large instances can take sometime to export and JIRA will appear to be inaccesible during this time, with nothing written to the logs or displayed in the GUI indicating any sort of progress.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28841].
  {panel}

To understand this better, let's create a user called "The A Team" (display name), and then a series of other users with various team names (about 20 of them).

Now go to any user picker in JIRA and try to select that user. Typing in team will bring up all the users with the name team, typing "A Team" will find none, but putting in the entire name "The A Team" will match it.

The current search method appears to be based mostly on prefix matching, but occasionally grabbing a keyword, but isn't quite fuzzy enough for scenarios like this.

Can we look at getting some fuzzier matching for display names that have multiple words, especially when starting with smaller / single character words.

Fundamentally it does not make sense for more specific search terms to return more results.
fields.summary: Better Username Matching in All User Pickers
Allow sub-tasks' time to be displayed in parent while preventing time being logged on the parent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28833].
  {panel}

It would be nice with a function for assigning a notification scheme to several projects in the same operation. (As described in JRA-4505 this could also be interesting to other sheme types as well.)

We have lots of JIRA projects and several notification schemes. Each time we take the production database and lift it over to our test system we have to disable notifications. As I understand it - and i have consulted the documentation - I have to make lots of operations i.e. disable notification for all projects one by one. Or change several notification schemes (and that is just as tedious).

I suggest that on the Notification scheme screne - you introduce a new screen where I can fill in with a checkbox for each project and then select any notificatin scheme - including "None" of course.

And why not doing this for other schemes as well. (see JRA-4505)

As proposed in JRA-4505 this might be done for all projects that belongs to the same category but I want also that it shall be possible to select from the whole project list.
fields.summary: Project bulk scheme change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28826].
  {panel}

When ordering by fixVersion in the Issue Navigator, it seems to incorrectly order by the ID ({{projectversion.id}}) rather than the name ({{projectversion.vname}}).

h5. To replicate:

# Create version 1-3.
# Create 3 issues.
# Assign version 1 to issue 1 and so on for the 3 issues.
# Go to the issue navigator and check the ordering of them (may need to modify columns). Example screenie attached.
# Go back to the project version and change version 2 to 8.
# Search again. Order is wrong, as per screenie.
fields.summary: Order version fields by their order on the configuration screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28824].
  {panel}

For some production JIRA-only instances, the "Import & Export" section is missing in the admin screen. Apart from the missing admin menu items in that section (which is "External System Import"), this also has implications for bundling the Backup Manager plugin for JIRA, since the menu item for that plugin is supposed to appear under that section.

[~mknight@atlassian.com] noticed this with a production 149 JIRA-only instance, and subsequent inspection of more production and development instances gave us the following observations:

* Out of 6 JIRA-only instances that were *upgraded* to 149, 5 of them have that section missing, one doesn't.
* Out of 3 JIRA-only instances that were *newly provisioned after 149 was released* (i.e. they were not upgraded), all of them still have that section.
* Inspection of one *non-JIRA-only* production 149 instance shows it still has that section
* An upgraded JIRA-only 149 dev instance has that section missing.
* A clean-installed JIRA-only 149 dev instance still has that section. 
* A clean-installed JIRA-only ondemand-master instance still has the section.
fields.summary: Some JIRA-only instances are missing the "Import & Export" admin menu section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28805].
  {panel}

Current it's possible to enter a user object filter or group object filter that exceeds the limitations of the database schema {{cwd_directory_attribute.attribute_value}} is a varchar(255). Can you look at adding this limitation into the JIRA GUI to prevent users from encountering a data truncation error in the logs? For example:

{noformat:title=atlassian-jira.log}
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.db.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:DirectoryAttribute][directoryId,10100][name,ldap.user.filter][value,(&(objectclass=unicornRider)(!(ou:dn:=Guardians of The Globe))(|(memberof=cn=Lightning Strike Thunderdome,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=jiradmins,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=strikeforceone,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=UAT,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=myspace,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers))] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO cwd_directory_attribute (directory_id, attribute_name, attribute_value) VALUES (?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'attribute_value' at row 1))
...
{noformat}

h3. To replicate

# Add a new User Directory to JIRA.
# Add a very long object or group filter.
# Attempt to synchronise, this will fail with a "Data truncation" error.

h3. Workaround

Please refer to the [Data Truncation due to Data too long for column|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/4I2GE] KB article.
fields.summary: Prevent data from exceeding the database limitations when configuring User Directories

Two minor things:

* "Add it now" - feels like its screaming at me, and we repeat it so often. Can we change it to a simple "Add"? We don't really postfix any of our actions with "Now".. we don't say "Create issue now" for creating an issue

* Can we make the Gadget URL's look a little bit more appealing? Problems right now:
** It looks silly when it's cut off, there is no indication there is more in the link 
Suggestion:
** Change it to say "Gadget Link" or
** Put a "..." at the end of the string if it doesn't fit in the macro browser 

* There seems to be a "forced" new blank line after every gadget link that is not necessary

https://skitch.com/sherif/erays/skitched-20120704-113117

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28794].
  {panel}

If you type a short phrase into the quick search box, the resulting JQL is pretty difficult to modify subsequently:

bq. (summary ~ "some text" OR description ~ "some text" OR comment ~ "some text")

It would be nicer if a quick search was turned into a simple text search across all the issue's text:

bq. text ~ "some text"

To ensure the quick search is still compatible with both the search builder and the JQL view, we'd probably also have to add a checkbox for "All text" under the free text search field in the search builder UI.

Something for the kick-ass effort, perhaps?
fields.summary: Quick search should expand to JQL [text ~ "some text"] not [(summary ~ "some text" OR description ~ "some text" OR comment ~ "some text")]
Rename View Version Control Permission to Display Source Tabs On Issues or something like that

Symptoms:
- Not able to set application access for some users. https://instance/secure/admin/user/ViewUser.jspa?name=username lacks the normal checkboxes. User also does not show up in the Application Access section.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28781].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in the introduction gadget. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all].

We would like to come up with a secure compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the introduction gadget for. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using the introduction gadget by asking you to comment on this issue.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand introduction gadget
JIRA to act as a SAML Service Provider in order to integrate into existing SAML-based SSO

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28779].
  {panel}

At the moment, JIRA activity stream will display commits from FishEye if:
* the repository's permission is configured to "anonymous".  This can be prevented by configuring the repo's permission to specific group(s).  
* user has permission to view the repository when each JIRA project is configured to retrieve information from different repository path using the Include/Exclude feature in FishEye.

It would be convenience for the users to have an additional configuration on the JIRA side to prevent commits messages on the Activity Stream.  

One user suggests

{quote}
My personal preference for the behaviour:

* global permission for "View Version Control" -> user can see commits from all projects, that he has permission for in fisheye (default: deactivated ). If activated, the system would behave as it does now..
* optional: project permission "View Version Control" => user can see only commits, that are targeted for his project ( fisheye permission is granted + jira has identified this commit as belonging to the project, i.e. commit contains issue id for this project)

This setup would avoid information leaks to jira due to anonymous access to fisheye.

In our scenario, jira is open to the internet and fisheye is not -> anonymous access to fisheye is ok for internal use, but jira should not show commits by default.
{quote}
fields.summary: Activity Stream Configuration for revision control system Commits

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28748].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hey All,

Thank you all for your patience and understanding over the lifespan of this ticket.

h5. What’s the deal?
I’m pleased to say that we have completed the necessary additional functionality to include Active Objects data when importing projects. This means you can now carry over your JIRA Agile project data between instances.

h5. What’s included?
*Sprint* and *Ranking* data are considered to be the most important types of data in JIRA Agile and was included in the Active Objects being imported.

As mentioned in our previous update, the solution doesn’t include all data found in JIRA Agile. *Boards*, which harboured too much complexity to deliver in this solution within a reasonable timeframe, has been excluded from this implementation.

h5. When can I use this?
JIRA Server will need to wait until the next major release of JIRA to utilise this feature.
Due to the internal changes necessary to provide this functionality, _both the +exporting+ and +importing+ JIRA instances need to be versions which have this new implementation_. This means Active Objects *_will not_* be imported when involving any instance that is not up-to-date with this functionality.

Once again, thank you for your patience and a *big thank you* to all the beta candidates that helped during our testing program for this feature.

Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
kewilliams at atlassian dot com  
{panel}

\\

If you are looking for JIRA Agile specific data, we are tracking this separately here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10577

*Original description below*
Currently, when performing a project import, it does not restore any plugin data, including JIRA Agile (formerly GreenHopper).  This is an issue, as many customers do use both JIRA with GH integration.

With the more recent releases of plugins, information is stored within AO tables, which the project import also ignores.  Some sample information that should be included:
* Ranking
* Start/End/Release dates for versions
fields.summary: Project Imports should include relevant Active Objects data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28745].
  {panel}

In the notification mails sent from JIRA the changed and deleted text is colored by some pale green and red colors.
 If there is a lot of text this coloring scheme is easily lost in the flurry of text.
 I would suggest that the colors are made much stronger. E.g. like the strong yellow, blue or orange colors we used to use for markup on real paper back in the days.
 Pale (or pastel) colors does not stand out strongly enough for a quick overview.
fields.summary: Notification mail changed/deleted text strings are hard to find due to pale coloring

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28734].
  {panel}

I am trying to set a Workflow Post-Function to assign an Issue to a specific Role Member. I see two options:

1. Assign to Role Member

2. Assign to Last Role Member.

What I am trying to do is assign the issue to someone in the specified Role, but I want to default it to someone who is in the role but was the Reporter or has been previously assigned the issue. If no one is found then the default user for that role is fine.

I chose 2, but what I am seeing is that if there was no one in the role that has been a reporter or assignee on the issue then the assignee stays the same.
fields.summary: Combine "Assign to Role Member" and "Assign to Last Role Member" in transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28733].
{panel}

{panel:title=Status Update 16/3/2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

Automatic backup scheduling IS on our list, although not in the very first horizon, as we are looking to completely overhaul the backup/restore experience.  Especially for those that have very large datasets.  With that said, there will be a mechanism available to automate this yourself, until we build that functionality into the UI. 

- https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Backup-Restore/gh-p/backupandrestore

Click the link, click request access, and we should get you in within 24 hours to review our strategy and provide feedback as we go. 
{panel}
 

h3. Problem Definition
As a user, I would want to have a feature where the backup manager can be automated by schedule.

h3. Workaround
(!) The below backup scripts are working (at this current point in time) but the endpoints might change without notice: (!)
 * [https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automatic-cloud-backup/src/master/]

Please be advised that you should avoid executing these backup scripts during [the maintenance window|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/maintenance-windows-744721660.html].

 

For more details on this, or for alternative ways to automate backups in Cloud, please refer to:
 - [How to Automate Backups for JIRA Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Automate+Backups+for+JIRA+Cloud+applications]
 - [Automate online site-backups for Jira and Confluence without programming|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Automate-online-site-backups-for-Jira-and-Confluence-without/ba-p/1271317]
fields.summary: Atlassian OnDemand backup manager automation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28727].
  {panel}

The summery of the issue gets corrupted by an additional string of characters.
this happens when the characters in the summary are non UTF-8 and the mailserver is using IMAP configuration.

Adding the following entry in the JAVA_OPTS could fix this issue: "-Dmail.mime.decodetext.strict=false"

When using the same summary and a POP server all goes well.
Attached screenshots for further reference.
fields.summary: issue summary corrupts due issue creation via email using IMAP when non UTF-8 characters are used in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28720].
  {panel}

Since JIRA is licensed per user it is important for administrators to identify users based on actions / usage metrics. Common fields that would need to be searched would be:

Reporter (number of issues reported in a period of time)
Watcher (number of issues being watched in a period of time)
Assignee (number of issues assigned to them in a period of time)
Pretty much any field with a user picker 

I think that this should be added to the Filter Users page in the Administration section.
fields.summary: Filter users by usage

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28707].
  {panel}

Found on v5.1-kickass9#757-sha1:a700ce2. If a user updates 2 single fields and the responses are received in reverse order it looks like update 2 never happened.

Steps to reproduce:
* Open up Charles proxy and set a breakpoint on the URL that the inline edit uses (IIRC it's /EditAction)
* Open an issue and edit its Priority. Click the checkbox. The request will show up in Charles's breakpoint view.
* On the same issue, type in a comment and click "Add". The 2nd request will show up in Charles' breakpoint view. Click Execute on this 2nd request. The comment appears on your issue.
* Now click Execute on the 1st request. The changed Priority appears on the issue, but the comment disappears. (!)
* Reload the page and both the changed Priority and the added Comment are visible.

Network latency can cause this to happen in real world usage. We should implement inline edit in such a way that the order of received responses does not affect what eventually gets shown (after all responses are in).

cc [~jcreenaune], [~sharwood]
fields.summary: Inline edit shows older version of issue if edit responses are received out of order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28672].
  {panel}

Hello team,

The dashboard filter error messages only display the filter number. 
The user has no way of knowing what filter this corresponds except if running a SQL query to match the number to a filter name. This behavior is unwanted if you have users which can fix the filters but doesn't have the necessary grants to query the database.
This error message should display the name of the filter so the user knows which of their filters needs to be fixed/edited.

See attached screen capture.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Dashboard filter errors display filter number instead of name

JIRA v5.0.6 does not allow you to see the Jira ID/issue number of the subtask you're creating, and once you create a subtask and submit the form you're returned to the page of its parent issue where you cannot see its Jira issue nubmer

Converting a JIRA Portlet to a Gadget Require Update
Bug: Preview does not work when adding a comment a...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28665].
  {panel}

We are heavily using the sub-tasks to split work packages for developers and we create hundreds of them. The parent issue is just used as a container to wrap all the sub-tasks. Our problem is that in terms of reporting and managing the work, one would almost certainly only want to look at the parent issue level (either directly at the issue or in a report) but the parent issue does not include any information from the sub-task.

I imagine this should function like the "Include Sub-tasks" feature for Estimates, where you can either just show the values of the parent or the accumulated values of the sub-tasks. Thus the activity log would show for the parent:

User ABC commented on ABC-42 - foobar not working
User XYZ started progress on ABC-42 / ABC-23 - Initial Investigation
...
fields.summary: "Include Sub-tasks" for Activity Log / Comments / Work Log of parent issue
DefaultEntityAsEventService performs unbounded search
Project Import should retain Rankings for GreenHopper
Create attachments from mails ignores the maximum attachment size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28652].
  {panel}

Hi,

I'm explaining my issue.

I've :

    - several projects: PR1, PR2, PR3
    - several groups of users (dev and manager) which are different for each product: PR1-dev, PR1-management, PR2-dev, PR2-management

For each project, I've:

    - one permission scheme: PR1-permission, PR2-permission
    - one notification schme: PR1-notification, PR2-notification

PR1-permission and PR2-permission are almost the same.
Differences are PR1-permission are used with PR1-dev and PR1-management groups. It's the same for PR2 project.

And this is the same for notification (PR1-notification with PR1-dev and PR1-management group).

So, I've a lot of permission scheme, and a lot of notification scheme, and a lot of group.

SO, I maybe, it should be good to have a general notification scheme for permission, notification and group and to be able to use a variable for name of permissions, notifications and group.

For exemple, a solution could be:
- in general config, enable or not variable name for permission, notification and group name
- some available variable should be "project name", "key", ....
- in creation of group, notification scheme or permission scheme, we can use a variable name. For example, <ProjName> would be substituted by the name of the project.

Don't hesitate to contact me for more explaination :)

Thanks

Mickael THIEVENT
SILKAN
fields.summary: Use a variable for name of permission scheme and notification scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28649].
  {panel}

We have the problem detailed below.... but what would be great is if in JQL, the result set of fields can be specified in the query (similar to SELECT SQL query)...

The reason being is that the result set returned is different for every user and we need a way to return a pre-configured set of fields for a third party app, irrelevant of the logged on JIRA user.

Here is the problem we have...

When a developer uses a third party application that interfaces to JIRA using the in-built searchrequest-printable url, the JIRA user (ie developer) is logged out from JIRA and the user account (used for the search) is automatically logged into JIRA.

Here is the code used by the third party app (ie. salesforce) that searches JIRA for matching issues:

document.getElementById('jiraSearch').src="http://ir-jira.ir.local:8080/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-printable/temp/SearchRequest.html?jqlQuery=%22SF%20Related%20Cases%22=" + id18 + "&os_username=salesforce&os_password=<hidden>";

As you can see, we provide a JIRA account (called salesforce) that provides the desired fields in the search result which are needed to be shown in the salesforce application. This is achieved by having a salesforce a configured salesforce user in jira with "Configured Columns" for the search results).

So what happens when a developer is logged into JIRA using their own account, and then switch to salesforce and cause salesforce to perform a search, the search (with salesforce account info) logs out the developer from JIRA and logs in the salesforce account!!!

This then causes the developer to have to log out from JIRA and log back in as themselves....

How can we prevent the salesforce search from logging out logged in JIRA users? and also provide a known configured set of fields from the search request to the third party app...
fields.summary: Support in JQL to select fields to be displayed in the result set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28645].
  {panel}

This was originally filed as a support request here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-38574 ; but they directed me that it was a feature improvement request and thus to come here.

{quote}Hi,

Our JIRA e-mail integration is working fine (all of the 'watched' issue notifications and such), and the e-mails come from jira@themis.atlassian.net, so all responses automatically go back into JIRA (posted to the issue as comments). This is all correct.

However, "mention" notification e-mails come from the user that executed the mention, which makes e-mail replies go directly back to that user, rather than back to JIRA. This is not desirable behaviour for us – we would rather that "mention" notification e-mails also come from jira@themis.atlassian.net, so that responses go back to the ticket rather than to the individual user.

Thanks.{quote}

In sum, I can easily see arguments for both sides of this (i.e. send from the executing user e-mail address vs. send from JIRA's system address).  What I am suggesting is an option that allows you to select one or the other according to your individual use case.

In our case, we very much want to keep all of the communication about an issue within JIRA, so that there is a central repository of all information about the issue -- rather than having it scattered around e-mail inboxes.

Obviously we can work around this by never replying to a "mention" e-mail, but it'd be much nicer if the "mention" e-mail could be replied to and the result was appended to the JIRA issue as a comment.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow option to configure JIRA "mention" e-mails to come from JIRA's address, not from the individual sender.
Create configurable Lucene segment size option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28643].
  {panel}

I am looking for a way to run a query that will return a list of Issues with the same value in a specified custom field.

For example:
Specified custom field is "Part Number"

Issues:
Issue 1 "Part Number" = 1234
Issue 2 "Part Number" = 0000
Issue 3 "Part Number" = 6789
Issue 4 "Part Number" = 1234
Issue 5 "Part Number" = 7689
Issue 6 "Part Number" = 8754
Issue 7 "Part Number" = 9454
Issue 8 "Part Number" = 2434
Issue 9 "Part Number" = 0000

Query would return:
Issue 1 "Part Number" = 1234
Issue 2 "Part Number" = 0000
Issue 4 "Part Number" = 1234
Issue 9 "Part Number" = 0000

Is there any way to do this in JQL?

Thanks
fields.summary: Searching for Issues with duplicate values in specified custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28640].
  {panel}

Hello Atlassian,

after asking Atlassian support to create different issue types via email for one project, I was recommended to create an improvement feature here.

We would like to have the possibility to define the needed issue type of an issue while creating it via email.

My thoughts therefore would be to add another parameter to the email's subject like: 
{code}
subject: [PROJECTKEY|ISSUETYPE-ID] title of issue
{code}

If ISSUETYPE-ID is not provided like \[PROJECTKEY\] or if the ISSUETYPE-ID is not known in PROJECT a default issue type should be chosen.

Thx for paying attention - perhaps you already got existing solutions or work around to get this working.

Best wishes
Christopher
fields.summary: Add an issue type parameter to email subject for creating issues
JSP-129906 - Adding Releases In Summary Of Version Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28635].
  {panel}

We have a lot of drop down in JIRA, Issue Type, Priority etc. that have replaced simple Select lists. The key difference between the two that I find really frustrating.


Consider this scenario. I want to lower to priority of this field using a normal select list. Ordering matters (is critical, in fact) in this case. 

I click on the field.

!https://img.skitch.com/20120621-k8nxyyjiec39qebkwhennxjhnq.png!

For a normal select list, it clearly shows where my current selection is (highlighted). I can easily select the item below or above it. Since the order matters, I also see where in the range of values my select is.

!https://img.skitch.com/20120621-k51kuddfgmcnq2e5u2mgrm32b4.png!

For the Frotherized drop down, you don't see the selected value in the list. You don't know what's above or below the current select value and you need to already know where the value sits in the continuum. The _first_ item on that list is what's selected, which isn't really what you want. From a keytboard shortcut it also doesn't really work.


h2. Thoughts on a solution

This is a big problem on fields / lists where order is critical (priority fields) and an annoyance on places where order is not critical (e.g. Rapid board drop down in GH, I know the board I care about all start with Bamboo, it'd be _nice_ if that area was highlighted).


I understand the heritage of Frother as an auto-complete / type ahead and search replacement,, rather than a select list but if we're going to support having the down arrow on the right and ability to use it like a select list, it really needs to work like one when you click on it.

I think it would work if:

* When no text has entered in the input field, onclick or on down arrow, show all values (if the drop arrow mode enabled) with the current value highlighted
* If you start typing in the field, the current behaviour is used. 

This is a pattern that's starting to repeat itself in a lot of places, and I think we need to seriously look at it from a overall UX perspective.

Maybe FEF or Design Trunk should look at this to get some consistency?
fields.summary: When clicking on a Drop down in form fields don't work like Select lists
